: You can designate a single plant as a sentry. The plant must be at least as large as a shrub or hedge. Should anyone besides you come within 3 steps of your designated plant, you will receive a psychic notification. However, you will not know the identity of the trespasser or the number of people. As plants do not have minds, they cannot be affected by the Obfuscate power; however, your plant sentry cannot see across the Shroud or the Gauntlet and cannot detect Wraiths or Spirits. You may only have a single sentry designated at a time, and this power lasts only a single night.
Terra Form

: You can awaken a single plant, causing it to uproot from the soil and "walk" for a short time. Plants animated in this way may move at 1 step per turn and can take no other actions. You may command it to root itself in the ground as you like, or it will do so on its own when this power ends. If no soil is immediately available, it will seek out the nearest patch. This effect lasts for 30 minutes.

You can compel various microflora and tiny organisms to serve your will as effectively as a standard plant. You may use One With the Forest and Leave Only Footprints indoors and in primarily urban settings as if they were an outdoor setting.

fields.testPool: Mental attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill

content.value: In ancient times, ships navigated by attuning their movements to a lodestar; a star chosen for its constancy, visibility, and reliability. For many sailors this was Polaris, but in the Southern Hemisphere the Southern Cross was the point of reference. Regardless of where you are, you are attuned to movement of the heavens and can discern your location with practically no effort. This attunement is strong enough to aid you in the face of powers that seek to disrupt your bearings.

Once learned, this power is always active. You are aligned with the stars, the seasons, and the celestial flow of the universe. You always know where you are geographically and can find your current or previous location on a map or give fairly approximate coordinates. You have this ability even if you are indoors or underground. In addition, unless you are influenced by a supernatural power, you cannot become lost as long as you are in the physical realm, or in another plane where you have an applicable Lore specialization. If you are involved in any challenges that affect your sense of location or your ability to locate something or someone, such as the elder power Mental Maze, the werewolf gift Trackless Wastes, tracking challenges, or the ritual Illuminate the Trail of Prey, you gain a +3 bonus to these challenges.
In addition, you may spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action to immediately gain familiarity with your current location.

When you lose a test against a power that involves your sense of direction or location, such as tracking challenges or the above examples, you gain a retest without having to spend Willpower. This retest acts in all ways like a Willpower retest.

Tied to the cycle of day and night, a circadian rhythm is the natural internal process that regulates the sleep-wake cycle of all living creatures, down to the smallest bacteria. Even unliving vampires are supernaturally compelled to sleep during the day, and when disturbed or forced awake, they are sluggish to act. By disrupting the circadian rhythm of a creature, you limit her ability to concentrate and perform to the best of her ability.

Spend 1 point of Blood and a simple action to activate Circadian Disruption. You immediately emanate a noticeable aura of lethargy. For the next 10 minutes, whenever you succeed in an offensive challenge using your Mental or Social attribute, any targets you succeed against also become
Disrupted

in addition to the power’s standard effects. While Disrupted, a character experiences momentary lethargy. This limits her skills to a maximum of 3 for the purposes of forming offensive and defensive test pools. A character remains Disrupted until the end of her next action. Multiple applications of this effect are not cumulative.
While Disrupted, characters with the Light Sleeper merit have their skills limited to 4 instead of 3. Creatures who do not sleep, such as zombies, are immune to this power.

A character remains Disrupted until the end of the next turn. In addition, while Disrupted, characters with the Deep Sleeper flaw have their skills capped at 2 and characters with the Light Sleeper merit have their skills capped at 3. Multiple applications of this effect are not cumulative. If a character is subjected to both the focus effect of this power and the standard effect, apply whichever penalty would last the longest.

Using this power in conjunction with another power makes the challenge magical in nature. Therefore, merits such as Magic Resistance, Countermagic, or certain flaws may apply to challenges where it may not normally be used. You must make your target aware of this power such that she can modify her test pools accordingly. This applies only to the initial challenge; a power such as Countermagic that removes magical effects could end this power but not a non-magical lasting effect such as Dominate.

The Red Star is a mysterious heavenly body which appeared on July 15, 1999, heralding a time of great trouble and turmoil. Known by many names ― Wormwood to the vampires, Anthelios to the werewolves, and the Eye of Balor to the fae ― the phenomenon was universally believed to be a sign of the End Times, specifically Gehenna for vampires. The final power of Caelestikinesis allows you to manipulate the residual energies of this event, focusing them on an individual and incapacitating her will through visions of her own doom.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action to make an opposed challenge. If you succeed, your target’s fate becomes intertwined with the star of destruction and calamity. While affected by Echoes of Anthelios, your target cannot spend Willpower to retest challenges or achieve exceptional successes. However, if she has an ability that allows her to retest without spending Willpower, such as Iron Will or Magic Resistance, she may use those abilities to retest normally. If your target has an effect that automatically grants her an exceptional success, determine an exceptional success normally.
Echoes of Anthelios lasts for 5 turns. During this time, your target feels a foreboding sense of existential dread.
Instead of losing the ability to spend Willpower for a retest, your target loses the ability to retest challenges. Merits such as Iron Will or Magic Resistance do not grant her the ability to retest.

Some say the sea is the memory of the world, preserving her secrets and treasures for a future age. Many cultures hold reverence for bodies of water that sustain life and grant reprieve to the weary. You have the talent for communing with the seas, lakes, streams, and even small ponds; peering into them as you would another’s soul, learning their secrets and the truth of what is hidden within the depths, and causing them to react to your will.

You can commune with a pool of water, causing it to obey your commands. Spend your standard action and 1 point of Blood. You may choose to pour the blood into the water in an offering to the spirits, though this is not required. The pool of water will respond to you as follows:
First Cumulative Application

: You may choose to influence the composition of the water, raising or lower its temperature. In large bodies of water, you can only alter the temperature up to one square mile in radius around you by a few degrees. In small ponds or bodies of water no larger than an olympic swimming pool you can change the temperature to a deep freeze or just below a boil or anywhere in between. This effect lasts for 1 hour. During this time, you may alter the temperature within the permissible range by spending another standard action. The temperature change occurs over the span of one turn.  A character trapped in a body of water frozen with this effect must succeed in a static challenge using her Physical attribute + Brawl test pool against a difficulty of 10 to escape.
Second Cumulative Application

: You can now enter into a communion with the pool of water. You may ask the pool of water to reveal an event which took place within the past 24 hours which will be replayed in the reflection of its depths, visible to all. Alternatively, you may ask it to reveal the location of any item which may be immersed or submerged within it. In larger bodies, this ability is limited to objects and events within a single square mile of your current location.
Third and Subsequent Cumulative Applications

: To a limited extent you may command the water to animate. You may ask it to part up to 100 yards so that you and any allies may pass. Alternatively, you may direct it to surge against a vessel no larger than a fishing boat or living target that is in the water or against a living target within 5 steps of it. Initiate an opposed challenge using your Mental attribute + Occult skill versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge or Drive skill, as appropriate. If you succeed against a vessel it becomes capsized, and if you succeed against a living target, they are knocked prone.

This power only functions on inanimate bodies of water. Animated bodies of water such as water spirits or elementals or water under magical applications such as Flowing Wall are not affected. Similarly, holy water blessed by individuals with True Faith cannot be affected.
When you activate this power, you may choose from any of the power’s 3 applications, without the need to activate them in order.

fields.title: Prison of Water

content.value: Water grants buoyancy and allows for fluidity of movement within itself, yet when it comes to walking, being wet becomes harrying and cumbersome. You can conjure tendrils of water that attach themselves to your target, limiting her movement. If applied in sufficient numbers, you can cause them to harden and freeze.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action to make an opposed challenge using your Mental attribute + Occult skill versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill targeting a character within your line of sight. If you succeed, watery chains manifest and wrap themselves around your target. She is affected as follows:
First Application
: Your target receives a -5 penalty to her initiative score. In addition, she is reduced to a maximum of 3 steps per each simple action spent on movement.
Second Application
: Your target’s total penalty is increased to a -10 penalty to her initiative. In addition, her movement is now limited to a maximum of 2 steps per each simple action spent on movement.
Third and Subsequent Applications

: The tendrils freeze, and your target’s initiative is limited to a maximum of 3. Her movement is limited to a maximum of 1 step per each simple action spent on movement. Bonuses to either movement or initiative do not apply, including supernatural bonuses.

fields.exceptional: You may choose to apply the effects of the next highest application instead of the current application.

content.value: If you or your target is within 5 steps of a 3 gallon or greater body of water, you may draw upon it to shape your chains. If you do, you may add a +3 wild card bonus to your test pool. This body of water must be visible and open; visible pipes or a sprinkler head does not count unless water is flowing from them.

This power can affect vampires in Mist Form, slowing them as the vapid form presses against the watery tentacles, and freezing them as if they were solid. All applications from this power fade 10 minutes after its most recent application.

fields.testPool: User's Mental attribute + Occult skill versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill targeting a character within your line of sight.

content.value: Drawing upon the tranquil properties of water, you can immerse yourself in a sense of calm. In this meditative state, thoughts flow freely, and the body’s energies work rapidly. With enough concentration you may experience a breakthrough as the reflective property of water opens the mind to infinite possibilities.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your simple action to activate this power as you enter a momentary state of deep thought and reflection. In this state, the body’s energies align, and healing occurs at a rapid pace. The use of this power does not require the presence of water, though thaumaturges often find it useful as a meditative focus. You receive benefits according to the following:
First Application
: You immediately heal up to 2 points of normal damage.
Second Application
: You immediately heal up to 2 points of normal damage.
Third Application
: You immediately heal up to 2 points of aggravated or normal damage.
Subsequent Applications
: You immediately heal up to 2 points of normal damage.

You may only use this power on yourself and you can use this power in combat. Unlike other Neptune’s Might powers, this power’s applications do not reset after 10 minutes, instead resetting at the end of the night. Therefore, you may only benefit from the third application once per game session.
Upon the third activation of this power, you may also recover up to 2 points of spent Willpower.

Water, while inherently formless, has the capacity to resist force. It does so in part through both its mass and fluidity, which ceaselessly shifts and evades. You can conjure a watery vortex that remains suspended in the air around you. This flowing barrier deflects blows and redirects harmful forces, ultimately freezing into a protective shell.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your simple action to conjure a swirling vortex of water. The water appears even in the absence of a nearby source and is clearly supernatural in origin. Once conjured, the Flowing Wall (and the subsequent icy barrier) is stationary and does not move. You may activate this power again over subsequent actions to achieve the following effects:
First Application
: You create a watery vortex that surrounds you and disorients attackers. While standing in the vortex you receive a +2 wild card bonus to your test pools involving your Dodge skill.
Second Application
: The vortex intensifies. While standing in it, you receive a +4 wild card bonus to your test pools involving your Dodge skill.
Third Application
: The vortex hardens and freezes, turning into an icy barrier (see below).
Subsequent Applications
: The icy barrier recovers 1 health level.

After 3 applications the vortex hardens and turns into an icy barrier. It no longer provides a bonus to Dodge, but instead limits your vulnerability to attacks. The barrier has 4 health levels, it is affected by attacks and powers that cause physical damage, and it has a defense pool of 10. For as long as it has any health levels remaining, you cannot be affected by Physical challenges. The barrier is translucent, allowing for you to use and be targeted by powers that require line of sight. You may target others with Thaumaturgy powers such as Firebolt or Lightning Bolt; your magical projectiles pass through the barrier. However, you cannot shoot a gun through the barrier nor can you be affected by incoming uses of Firebolt or Lightning Bolt while the barrier still stands. You may not initiate Melee or Unarmed attacks against targets outside the barrier.

Upon losing all of its health levels, the barrier shatters and you can be targeted normally. Any damage from the final blow in excess of the barrier’s health levels does not harm you. If your icy barrier shatters, you may activate Flowing Wall once again to create a new vortex, starting over with the first application. The effects of this power end after 10 minutes, when the barrier is destroyed, or until you leave the center of the vortex or freely exit the barrier.

You can create a broader vortex and barrier capable of encompassing up to 2 additional people. If, due to the focus, you are shielded by another’s barrier or if you shield another practitioner through the focus with your vortex or barrier, you and any other shielded practitioner cannot not surround yourselves with, or claim the benefits from, multiple vortexes or barriers. Instead, an additional practitioner shielded by the focus who uses this power augments the already existing vortex or barrier by adding to the number of applications in effect.

fields.title: Dehydrate

content.value: The average human body is over 60% water and contains 5 liters of blood, making it reliant on the flow of liquids in order to maintain its function. Like the unrelenting sun, you have the power to extract the moisture from your target’s body, leaving her weathered and debilitated. This process accelerates through reverse osmosis; but draining a target of moisture becomes difficult once moisture becomes scarce.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action to make an opposed challenge using your Mental attribute + Occult skill versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill, targeting a character within your line of sight. If you succeed, your target’s blood evaporates from her body and disappears. She is affected as follows:
First Application
: Your target loses 4 points of Blood.
Second Application
: Your target loses half her remaining Blood, rounded down.
Third Application
: Your target loses all but her last 3 points of Blood. This application has no effect if the target has 3 points of Blood or fewer remaining.
Subsequent Applications
: Your target loses 1 point of Blood.

If your target is a living creature, she loses health levels in addition to points of Blood. Wraiths, certain types of spirits, and other creatures that do not have liquid anatomical components are unaffected by this power, subject to the Storyteller’s discretion.

fields.exceptional: You may choose to apply the effects of the next highest application. For example, if you achieve an exceptional success on the first application, you may apply the effects of the second application instead.

content.value: Your target must instead defend with her Physical attribute + Willpower if you so choose but you must declare that intent when you activate the power.

fields.testPool: User's Mental attribute + Occult skill versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill, targeting a character within your line of sight.

content.value: Objects exert gravitational force upon each other relative to their size and the distance between them. Even distant and lonely objects exert some pull, while nearby objects maintain an orbit. By invoking Gravity Well, you can magnify the gravitational pull that your physical form has on other living objects, forcing them closer to you.

Spend one point of Blood and your simple action to surround yourself with a significant gravitational pull. Once activated, and at the beginning of the everyman round, all characters within 10 steps of you must take one step directly toward you. This step does not count toward their movement rate or actions and is done outside of initiative. If a character is affected by multiple Gravity Wells, she takes a direct step toward each in the order the Gravity Wells were created.

This movement is considered involuntary. Therefore, a creature who has been ordered through the use of Dominate to remain in place will still move; however, a character with the elder power King of the Mountain does not have to move. Environmental effects that regulate movement still apply, such as if a character is chained to a wall; such characters cannot move beyond the limits of their confinement. Effects that rely on voluntary movement, such as Rigor Mortis, are not influenced by this movement. Characters involved in a Grapple move together.

Gravity Well lasts for 10 minutes and only affects living or unliving creatures; inanimate objects and non-ambulatory life such as plants or dead creatures are not affected. A character may only conjure one Gravity Well at a time. If she conjures a second, the first one immediately ends.

Your Gravity Well extends an additional 5 steps. In addition, you can invoke Gravity Well on a static location rather than having the power’s effect centered on you. Once you have created a static Gravity Well, the effect remains stationary even if you centered the Gravity Well on an object that is then moved. If the origination of a Gravity Well is not centered on you, you may choose whether you are subject to its pull.

fields.title: Carnivorous Roots

content.value: Mortals forget the destructive power of a tree’s roots until it is too late, unaware as they spread deep underground, wrapping around gas lines, uplifting and cracking cement, and shifting buildings in their wake. The bioarcanists have turned the destructive power of roots to their advantage, imbuing them with the ability to syphon life energies.

Once learned this power is always active. When using Boughs Below, you may target up to 3 individuals, making a separate challenge against each. If you spend a point of Willpower to retest against any of them, you may also retest against any remaining targets who you have not tested against without spending additional Willpower.

In addition, at the end of the turn, if you have a target Grappled by Boughs Below, you may drain her of a single point of Blood which you may then absorb. Traits of Blood absorbed in this way are purified through a complex system of roots and do not convey any harmful effects, such as the blood bond.

Targets who are Grappled by Boughs Below are considered valid targets for your powers that require you to directly Grapple your target, such as Cauldron of Blood, Withering, or Necrosis. Only disciplines and Thaumaturgy powers may be used in this way; techniques and elder powers cannot. Any activation costs for those powers must be paid separately from those required for Boughs Below. Note: This effect does not allow a subsequent single target power to be used to affect all targets Grappled by Boughs Below ; however, you may choose which target is affected.

fields.testPool: Mental attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill

content.value: With this level of mastery, a vampire can commute a small portion of her blood into a caustic acid. Thus transmuted, the vampire can spit this toxic blood at an opponent, searing ﬂesh and corroding bone.

Spend 1 Blood point. For the rest of the turn, you may use a standard action to spit toxic blood at your target. Attacks made with Taste of Death are made using a test pool consisting of your Physical attribute + Athletics versus the target’s Physical attribute + Dodge.

When you make an attack using Taste of Death, you must choose whether the blood you spit with this power is transmuted into the poison of Scorpion’s Touch or the vitriolic ichor of Baal’s Caress. Utilizing Scorpion’s Touch through Taste of Death causes the victim to suffer the effects listed under that power. Spitting the ichor of Baal’s Caress deals 2 points of aggravated damage to your target.
Taste of Death can be used during Celerity rounds.

If Taste of Death is used to carry Scorpion’s Touch, anyone poisoned suffers a -3 penalty to all Physical attack test pools, rather than the standard -2 penalty.
If Taste of Death used to carry Baal’s Caress, your attack inﬂ icts 3 points of aggravated damage, instead of the standard 2.

This vicious power allows a vampire to use a target’s blood against her, bursting blood vessels and causing organs to bleed internally. These ruptures are intensely painful, delivering swift internal agony to anyone affected by this power.

Spend 1 point of Blood, expend your standard action, and engage your target in an opposed challenge using the Quietus test pool. If you succeed, you cause your target’s internal organs to rupture and bleed.

A character successfully targeted by Dagon’s Call takes 2 points of normal damage in any turn during which she spends Blood. This damage occurs the moment the victim spends her ﬁrst point of Blood in a given turn. After the ﬁrst turn, you can spend your simple action on every subsequent turn in order to maintain this power’s effect, for up to ﬁve turns in total.

Damage caused by Dagon’s Call cannot be reduced or negated. Multiple uses of Dagon’s Call do not stack. A character affected by two uses of this power still only takes 2 points of normal damage per turn.
Your target takes 3 normal damage, rather than 2, on any turn during which she spends Blood.

If your target has some of your blood on her person (knowingly or unknowingly), or if your target has ingested your blood within the last 24 hours, you do not need line of sight to use Dagon’s Call, so long as the target is within one mile. Individuals who have been affected by your Scorpion’s Touch or Baal’s Caress are considered to have your blood on them for the purpose of using Dagon’s Call.

You are one of the Created – more stone than vampire. Your heart no longer beats but rests in its stony chamber inside your chest. Stronger than any wood that could pierce it, it has dulled you to the emotional and mental influences of others, including the Beast that sleeps inside you.

Once purchased this power is always active. Your heart becomes solid stone, making you immune to the Pierce Heart Combat Maneuver for as long as your heart remains in your body. Any time you test for frenzy you may spend 1 Blood to automatically win the challenge. Additionally, you may choose to resist any mental or social challenges using your Physical Traits + Survival instead of the normal test pool required. Further whenever you spend a point of Willpower to retest a Social power, you immediately regain the Willpower spent for that challenge.  If your heart is removed from your body, this power and all of its benefits end.

While airborne combat is usually about speed, grace, and mobility, for you it is simply about one thing: momentum. Your stony physique gives you additional advantages over fleshy combatants, allowing you to fly faster and hit harder.
Once purchased this power is always active and gives you several advantages when using Aerial Combat Maneuvers.
You may use the Dive Bomb or Plummet Aerial Combat Maneuvers without spending Willpower.
When using Plummet your test pool is not reduced by 2 and you may affect opponents that have the Stamina focus.
When using Dive Bomb your attack does an additional level of damage. Further, you may use this power without being able to fly but you must be 6 steps vertically higher than your opponent.

When using Elude or Dive Bomb you may use up to 3 movement steps to pass through or into substances you can affect with Bond With the Mountain without paying an additional standard action cost to activate that power.

In addition, if you wish to use an Aerial Combat maneuver but do not possess a means of flight (such as the 1-point Gargoyle merit Flight), you may spend a point of Blood to briefly manifest stony wings which grant you the needed propulsion for the turn.

fields.title: Cataclysmic Upheaval

content.value: Your affinity for stone has granted you a devastating control over the earth and everything that stands upon it. Simply by touching the ground you can generate powerful tremors and terrible havoc. The ground, the rocks within the Earth, ancient foundations, and newly planted steel supports all bend to your will, crushing your enemies.

Spend 2 points of Blood and your standard action to touch the ground, calling the earth to rise to you as it carries boulders, pipes, and foundational beams in a crushing attack against your foes. You may make an opposed challenge against everyone within 10 steps. You may exempt a number of allies from the challenge equal to your dots of the Survival skill. Any who lose the challenge suffer 3 points of damage that cannot be reduced or negated as the ground on which they stand crushes them. Should you desire, those affected are dragged and must take up to 5 steps in your direction. You may ignore previous immovable obstacles, such as boulders and support beams when moving your opponents. Should you spend 1 point of Willpower to retest any of these opposed challenges, you also gain that retest for the remainder of the opposed challenges without spending further Willpower. If you spend the Willpower to retest after some challenges are already resolved, you cannot go back to previous challenges you have lost and apply that Willpower retest retroactively.

fields.exceptional: Targets against whom you achieve an exceptional success suffer an additional point of normal damage that cannot be reduced or negated. In addition, they are knocked prone.

content.value: By loosening the cohesion of your own muscles and skin you can defy the natural boundaries of shape, evolving into a superior hybrid composition of multiple forms. You may alter this form to suit your needs, choosing among the various shapes within your repertoire. Most who look upon the form of a Ravenous Conglomeration find it terrifying in the extreme; the fuel for nightmares and horror films. You, however, see it for what it is — the very essence of Vicissitude made manifest.

Once learned, this power is always active. You are no longer bound by the rule limiting you to a single major transformation power at a single time. Instead, you may assume up to 2 major transformations simultaneously, becoming a horrifying gestalt of monstrous features. You may also choose to combine the effects of your Bonecraft alterations with another major transformation, though retaining your Bonecraft effects in this way counts as one of your major transformations. You may not activate the same power twice.

You may also spend 4 points of Blood and a simple action to activate any number of your transformation powers instead of paying their individual blood and action costs. This activation is subject to your limits above.
If one of your assumed forms renders you immaterial or unable to attack, such as Blood Form, Mist Form, or Tenebrous Form, your combined form is unable to attack.

Example: Roscoe, Paladin to Regent Temoch, is challenged to monomacy by the head of the Ultraconservatives. As the contest begins, Roscoe spends 4 points of Blood and his simple action to activate Ravenous Conglomeration. Roscoe may choose to activate up to 2 major transformation powers, or he may activate one major transformative power and substitute a number of Bonecraft alterations up to his maximum in exchange for another major transformation. He may also activate any number of minor transformations as well. In addition to his Vicissitude powers, Roscoe also has 4 dots of Protean. He chooses to activate Horrid Form, Shape of the Beast, Feral Claws, and Eyes of the Beast, erupting into a terrifying amalgamation of fur, muscle, and claws with burning red eyes.

The ultimate goal of a Seeker is Azhi Dahaka – the penultimate state of shape mastery named after a Persian god. While some conjecture that this state is philosophical in nature akin to a state of mind similar to Golconda, others believe that it is an achievable state of physical preeminence and mental impermanence gained through a deeper understanding of Vicissitude. The Seekers who practice this power have declared it the highest expression of their art, believing it capable of granting spiritual communion with the Eldest.
Once learned, this power is always active. You gain every attribute focus. Any powers or flaws that remove focuses, such as Total Insanity or the Stolen Potential flaw, still apply.

Once per night, you may also spend 3 uninterrupted standard actions to reassign your bonus attribute dots from one attribute category to another. For example, if you had 4 bonus attribute dots in the Physical category, you could reassign 2 to the Mental category and 2 to the Social category. When you do this, you may also change your Archetype. However, you may still only gain a benefit from your Archetype once per hour. Changing your Archetype does not reset this effect. Each night upon waking you will revert to the original attribute and bonus attribute dots recorded on your character sheet, along with your recorded Archetype.

Although some vampires decry the notion that Vicissitude is an art, the Tzimisce say such closed-minded critics are held back by a perspective rooted in humanity or a weak stomach; both of which they can fix. For you, your mastery of the body sculpting powers of Vicissitude has reached a truly elite level. Indeed, Tzimisce of such skill are highly sought after, both by supplicating clients and as artists whose creations never fail to amaze and entertain. Interesting, creative or especially ironic applications of Virtuoso del Corpo have been known to bring macabre artists great acclaim.
Once learned, these powers are added to your list of Boncraft effects and are considered Bonecraft powers for all purposes.
Bauble:

You can reduce your subject to an object no smaller than half her original size, such as an ottoman or a lamp. While in this form she maintains awareness of her surroundings but is unable to move unless you specifically granted her limbs for that purpose. Similarly, unless you crafted your subject in such a way as to permit her to spend Blood, you subject cannot spend Blood or use Physical or Social disciplines while in this form. Further, your subject cannot speak unless you sculpt them a mouth. If your subject was not given a mouth, limbs to move, or the ability to spend Blood, she cannot use powers that require those things.  However, she retains any Fortitude powers she may have.  Any specimens must be incapacitated in order to be sculpted into a Bauble.
Chiropteran Marauder:

By connecting the subject’s limbs to her body with thin membranes you or your target can achieve flight in a limited fashion. If someone with Chiropteran Marauder falls from height, they can spread their arms and use these proto-wings to glide safely to the ground. In addition, they may fly three steps per turn by spending both a simple and standard action.
Kraken's Kiss:

By applying this modification to yourself or another you can alter a mouth to become oversized and alien, possibly with a cephalopod’s beak or an insect-like proboscis. Surprisingly, it does not impair speech. When someone with Kraken’s Kiss drinks blood, it allows her to drain 2 points of Blood as a simple action after a Grapple has been established. If desired, Kraken’s Kiss can also be used to force a Blood trait into a victim.
Living Weapon:

You can craft a series of horns and bone spurs which protrude from your body, honing it into a capable and effective weapon. Your Brawl attacks gain the Reach quality plus one other Melee weapon quality that you choose when you apply this modification.
Simplified:

You have selected a single purpose for your subject and liberated her of any cumbersome structure or musculature that you deem unnecessary for her chosen task. This task must be non-combat in nature, such as doing your laundry, driving your car, or holding a mirror while showering you in obsequious praise. The application of this modification causes your target to take on an exaggerated and grotesque form, with awkward limbs and unnatural proportions. She receives a -5 penalty to her Physical attribute when not performing the task you have chosen, or a +2 bonus to her Physical attribute when she is performing that task, or something that effectively uses the same set of motions. Any specimens must be incapacitated in order to undergo this application of Virtuoso del Corpo.
Skin Trap:

By altering the composition of the skin, it becomes severely adhesive, similar to the inside of a Venus Flytrap. You do not need to spend Willpower to perform the Grapple combat maneuver, and you receive a +2 bonus when attempting to Grapple.
Skittering Legs:

Though versatile, human musculature is often outclassed by lesser animals. By applying Virtuoso del Corpo to yourself or another, you modify their form in such a way as to increase the movement rate by up to 5 steps per action; however, the movement must always be in a straight line without turns or side steps.
